metadata.title: CVE-2022-38478 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Members the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present inFirefox 103, Firefox ESR 102.1, and Firefox ESR 91.12. Some of these bugsshowed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effortsome of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.2, Thunderbird < 91.13, Firefox ESR< 91.13, Firefox ESR < 102.2, and Firefox < 104.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38478` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required
